page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION.
page.content: The area, studied by top infants and top juniors, is on the west side of Shrewsbury, stretching from Bowbrook to Porthill in the south; from Bicton to Berwick in the north. It includes Copthorne, The Mount, Porthill, Shelton, Bicton and Bicton Heath. The south-east corner of the area is a residential suburb of Shrewsbury. To the north and west there are isolated dwellings in the midst of agricultural land, which makes up 75% of our block. The A5 road crosses the area in a south-east/north-west direction, with the A458 and B4386 extending westwards. In the north-east corner of the block the River Severn cuts through the relatively flat land. There is no major industry here, the main employers being the hospital and Water Authority at Shelton.
